column1: McCain does not allow his staffers to hold positions as lobbyists.[67]
column3: Obama does not take contributions from federally registered lobbyists or PACs, though he does accept money from non-federal lobbyists and unregistered lobbyists.[67]

column4: At the beginning of his campaign, Nader stated that he will receive no money from commercial interests
column5: no money from political action committees
column6: only from individuals."[41] He sees Washington D.C. as "corporate-occupied territory
column7: every department agency controlled by overwhelming presence of corporate lobbyists
column8: corporate executives in high government positions."[41] He supports public financing of campaigns and free TV and radio time for ballot qualified candidates.[68]"

column1: John McCain voted for the appointment of Justice Roberts. McCain favors a more Constructionist standpoint and says he would work to safeguard against Judicial activism.[160]
column3: Barack Obama was 1 of 22 Senators to vote against the appointment of Justice Roberts.
